subject: Re: [junit] Junit new bee assert for a method which might or might not return values
msgSnippet: ... I assume that your saying that you re testing a method that may return null or may return a list.  If you re not sure which will come back when you run
messageBody:
On Tue, Sep 2, 2008 at 8:23 PM, miro <miroconnect@...> wrote:
>
> my method might return a value or might not.
> So I am wondering what should be final line in my test case like assert?
> here is my code
> public void testFindOPPseDmReq() throws Exception {
> List list =storageRequestDAO.findOPPseDmReq();
> //assertEquals(list.size()>0, true);
> }
> call tot his method might return values or might not in this case how should
> my test case looklike ?
> what should assert here ?
>

I assume that your saying that you're testing a method that may return
'null' or may return a list. If you're not sure which will come back
when you run the test, then you're test is not really useful.

I would propose that you need at least two tests:

1) Set up the DAO so that it returns an expected 'null', and then
assertNull to check it.
2) Set up the DAO so that it returns an expected number of records,
and then check that exactly that number is returned
(assertEquals(list.size(), n), where n is the expected number of
records).

Both of these tests either require you to put the database that the
DAO talks to in a known state, or to decouple the DAO from an actual
database. You might also think about returning an empty List in the
case that you have zero records to remove the need for 'null' checks
in your code.

Hope that helps,
- Bill

--
Bill Woodward wpwood@... http://www.saifa.net
